text: One Hundred Years of Solitude (Spanish: Cien años de soledad) is a book written by Nobel Prize-winning author Gabriel García Márquez. It was published in 1967 and translated to English by Gregory Rabassa in 1970. This book is thought to be Marquez's magnum opus and one of the best books ever written in the Spanish language. It follows the Buendia family in the fictional town of Macondo. Category:1967 books Category:Books by Gabriel García Márquez Category:Spanish-language literature
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
